intro: Chloris gayana subsp. oligostachya, commonly known as slender grass or slender wheatgrass, is a perennial grass native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender,丛生 (clumping) growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with numerous short, clustered spikelets. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a valuable forage species for livestock. Its botanical features make it suitable for erosion control and soil stabilization in degraded landscapes.
